intro: Vittadinia consanguinea, commonly known as the yellow daisy or swamp daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in wet or swampy areas, preferring moist soils. It has small, spoon-shaped leaves and produces numerous small florets arranged in a composite flower head. Vittadinia consanguinea is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to saline environments.
